meanings.definition: The state or quality of being burdensome or unwieldy.
meanings.sent1: Carrying all those heavy bags created a lot of cumbersomenesses for me.
meanings.sent2: The cumbersomenesses of the old furniture made it hard to move.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dance with two left feet added an extra layer of cumbersomenesses to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The cumbersomenesses of the bureaucracy slowed down the entire process.
meanings.sent5: The cumbersomenesses of the giant backpack felt like a mountain on my shoulders.

meanings.definition: The condition of being awkward or difficult to handle.
meanings.sent1: Her dress's long train caused cumbersomenesses as she tried to walk.
meanings.sent2: The cumbersomenesses of the new software system confused many employees.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful cumbersomenesses made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The cumbersomenesses of the situation weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent5: The cumbersomenesses of the tangled wires resembled a puzzle waiting to be solved.
